channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The FDA will lift warnings on hormone therapy for menopause
item.description: Hormone therapy drugs have carried box warning labels for years. The Food and Drug Administration is removing them, saying the risks were overstated.

item.title: Car explosion near Red Fort in India's capital kills at least 8 people, police say
item.description: A car exploded near the 17th century Red Fort in New Delhi on Monday, killing at least eight people, injuring others and triggering a fire that damage...

item.title: 'Death by Lightning' unfolds like an 1880s 'West Wing'
item.description: Netflix's new four-part miniseries dives into the plot to assassinate President James Garfield. Death by Lightning is full of recognizable arrogance, ...

item.title: Trump slams air traffic controllers who called out during the government shutdown
item.description: Trump said on social media that he wasn't happy with controllers who called out of work, and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't take any t...

item.title: Supreme Court declines to revisit gay marriage decision
item.description: The challenge to the court's 2015 ruling came from Kim Davis, the former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue same-sex licenses after the court's Oberg...

item.title: Sen. John Fetterman slams lawmakers fundraising amid shutdown: "I refuse to monetize the outrage"
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman slammed lawmakers who are fundraising as Americans face "mass chaos" at airports, food uncertainty and missed paychecks during the...

item.title: Airlines cancel thousands more flights in U.S. over government shutdown
item.description: Airlines are expected to cancel 4% of Monday's flights at 40 of the busiest airports in the U.S. to comply with an order from the FAA.

item.title: At least eight killed after car explodes near Delhi's Red Fort
item.description: Twenty more were injured in the blast, the cause of which is still unknown, authorities say.

item.title: What Trump's 50-year mortgage plan could mean for homebuyers
item.description: Details are still sparse, but a 50-year loan could meaningfully reshape a housing market where 30 years is the norm.

item.title: Canada loses its measles-free status, with US on track to follow
item.description: The country hasn't been able to curb an outbreak of more than 5,000 cases over the last year, while US cases are at a 33-year high.

item.title: Nord Stream suspect accuses Italy of pressure to confess
item.description: Serhiy Kuznetsov is wanted in Germany over the 2022 attack on Russia's Nord Stream gas pipelines.

item.title: Sen. John Fetterman explains why he's been "voting consistently" to reopen the government
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania says he's been "voting consistently" to reopen the government because it's "always wrong" to shut it down. He says...

item.title: Former French president Sarkozy released from prison after three weeks
item.description: The former French president was jailed in October for conspiring to fund his election campaign with money from late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.

item.title: Verified videos show aftermath of explosion in Delhi
item.description: Police say eight people have been killed after a car explodes near Delhi's Red Fort landmark in India.

item.title: Arctic air hits much of the US, bringing snow to some areas and very chilly temperatures to Florida
Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide
item.description: The Supreme Court has rejected a call to overturn its landmark decision that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide.

item.title: Sen. John Fetterman on health care protections: "We have to negotiate" with Republicans
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman says Republicans and Democrats "have different priorities," but health care protections and making health care more affordable is ...

item.title: While Trump threatens controllers, US flight cancellations will drag on even after shutdown ends
